intro: Muehlenbeckia quadrangulata, commonly known as the square-stemmed muhlenbeckia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 1 meter, featuring slender, square-shaped stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly rough texture, often with a bluish-green hue. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forest margins and rocky areas.
